--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Eric Armstrong <eric.armstrong@s...> 
wrote:
> "Mike Colbert " wrote:
> 
> >  One technique we use, with Java, is to implement our JUnit 
TestCases
> > as static inner classes.  This gives you the access you require.  
>
> This sounds like a really great idea.
> 
> I only recently became enamored of JUnit, as a result of 
JUnitDoclet's
> creating a test framework for me. That shortened the JUnit learning
> curve, which helped a lot.
> 
> I'm curious. Do you know of any IDEs that support this technique by
> generating static inner test classes?

It shouldn't be too difficult to program Emacs to do it.  Interesting 
idea ...

Mike
